SEARCH

Class Main

java.lang.Object
Main
public class Main extends Object
The Main class serves as the entry point for a transport simulation program. It provides methods for handling file input, processing transport orders, and managing a fleet of vehicles. The program reads data from a specified file, including details of storages, buyers, orders, and available transports. It simulates the delivery process by assigning transports to orders, considering factors like transport capacity, distance to the delivery point, and order deadlines. The simulation outputs the progress and results of deliveries, including the number of completed orders and the amount of coal delivered. The Main class uses a series of static methods to perform its operations, which include: - Parsing command-line arguments to configure file paths. - Cleaning input files from unnecessary characters. - Finding the slowest transport, the closest storage to an order, and the most relevant transport for an order. - Adding and managing active transports. - Processing and fulfilling orders through a simulated environment. Command-line arguments allow the user to specify the input file and whether to use the current directory for file paths.

  • Constructor Details

    • Main

      public Main()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main entry point of the program.

      Parses command-line arguments to configure the file reading process and starts the order processing simulation. It supports a '-f' option to specify the input file and an optional '-cR' flag to use the current directory for the file path. After setting up the environment, it reads and processes all orders from the file, simulating the delivery process and outputting the results to the console.

      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments for configuring the simulation. Expected arguments include: - "-cR" to indicate that the current directory should be used for file paths. - "-f" followed by the filename to specify the input file for the simulation.

    • fillTheActiveTransportList

      public static void fillTheActiveTransportList(int amount)
      Fills the active transport list with a specified amount of transport objects. Each transport will be tasked to deliver a calculated number of orders.
      Parameters:
      amount - The number of transport objects to add to the active list.

    • findTheMostRelevantCar

      public static Transport findTheMostRelevantCar(Storage storage, double time)
      Finds the most relevant transport based on its proximity to a given storage and its availability within the specified time.
      Parameters:
      storage - The storage to find the closest transport to.
      time - The simulation time by which the transport must be available.
      Returns:
      The most relevant Transport object, or null if none are suitable.

    • proceedAnOrder

      public static void proceedAnOrder()
      Processes an order from the queue. This method simulates the order fulfillment process, assigning transports, loading coal, delivering orders, and managing transport time and coal capacity.

    • findTheSlowestTransport

      public static Transport findTheSlowestTransport()
      Finds and returns the slowest transport in the list of available transports.
      Returns:
      The Transport object with the slowest speed. If no transports are found, the behavior is undefined.

    • findClosestStorageToTheOrder

      public static Storage findClosestStorageToTheOrder(Order order)
      Finds the storage closest to the specified order based on distance.
      Parameters:
      order - The order to which the closest storage is to be found.
      Returns:
      The closest Storage object to the specified order.

    • findOrderByBuyer

      public static Order findOrderByBuyer(Buyer buyer)
      Finds the order in the queue that corresponds to a specific buyer.
      Parameters:
      buyer - The buyer whose order needs to be found.
      Returns:
      The Order object corresponding to the specified buyer, or null if the buyer has no orders.

    • findPlaceFromIndex

      public static APlace findPlaceFromIndex(int index)
      Determines the place (either a storage or a buyer) based on the given index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index that identifies the place. If the index is greater than the number of storages, it corresponds to a buyer; otherwise, it corresponds to a storage.
      Returns:
      The APlace object identified by the index.

    • getRandomTransport

      public static Transport getRandomTransport()
      Selects and returns a random transport based on their representation probabilities.
      Returns:
      A new Transport object selected randomly based on the representation weight.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If an error occurs during the selection process.

    • cleanFile

      public static String cleanFile(FileReader file) throws IOException
      Processes the contents of a file, removing sequences between pairs of '❄' (snowflake) and '⛏' (pickaxe) symbols, replacing them with a single space.
      Parameters:
      file - The FileReader object representing the file to be processed.
      Returns:
      A String with the cleaned file content.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • readFile

      public static void readFile(FileReader file) throws IOException
      Reads and parses the content of a file to initialize storages, buyers, edges in a graph, transports, and orders. It uses the cleanFile method to preprocess the file content before parsing.
      Parameters:
      file - The FileReader object representing the file to be read and parsed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • soutDeliveredOrder

      public static void soutDeliveredOrder(double simulationTime, Transport transport, Order order, Storage storage)
      Outputs the details of a delivered order to the console. It prints the simulation time, transport identifier, customer index, amount of coal delivered, and the time reserve based on the deadline after the coal is unloaded.
      Parameters:
      simulationTime - The current time in the simulation when the order is being processed.
      transport - The Transport object that is delivering the order.
      order - The Order object containing details about the coal and customer.
      storage - The Storage object from where the coal is being delivered.
